p: Genital herpes (caused by the herpes simplex viruses (HSV), most often by HSV-2) plays a major role in HIV transmission nowadays, but its slow monotonic spread made it to be an important cause of genital ulcers in Africa only after the mid eighties [76]. Accordingly, HSV-2 seroprevalence in Kinshasa, in 1959, was 21% (and 6% in rural Congo), and it took 26 years to attain 60% [76].
